page.title: 01Upper Strensham District
page.content: Upper Strensham, Worcestershire is a small village lying between the River Avon and the River Severn. The Gloucestershire border marks the southern boundary. The land surrounding the village is used mainly for mixed farming with arable crops predominating. There is also a considerable amount of common land. The village is bypassed by the M5 and Strensham service area is immediately north of the village and the M50-M5 junction is just south of it. The A38 runs through the south west section of the district. Severn Trent have a plant and filter beds near the Avon, and a pipeline carries water over it to Bredon Hill. Our block includes small sections of Ripple, Bredon. The part of Twyning covered by it has the only dense housing in the area.
